dublinCore.dc:title: 114 S1247 IS: To designate Union Station in Washington, DC, as “Harry S. Truman Union Station”.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mrs. McCaskill (for herself and Mr. Blunt) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works

form.official-title: To designate Union Station in Washington, DC, as Harry S. Truman Union Station.

subsection.text: Union Station, located at 40 Massachusetts Avenue, NE., Washington, DC, shall be known and designated as Harry S. Truman Union Station.

Any reference in a law, map, regulation, document, paper, or other record of the United States to the facility referred to in subsection (a) shall be deemed to be a reference to the Harry S. Truman Union Station.
